00043 class KVIRC_API KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData
00044 {
00045         friend class KviKvsRunTimeContext;
00046 protected:
00047         KviKvsHash       * m_pExtendedScopeVariables; // extended scope vars, shallow, may be 0
00048         KviKvsSwitchList * m_pAliasSwitchList;        // switches for the aliases, shallow, may be 0
00049         KviKvsObject     * m_pThisObject;             // the current object for object function calls
00050         QString          * m_pScriptFilePath;         // the current script file path, shallow, may be 0
00051         bool               m_bAutoDelete;
00052 public:
00053         // all shallow data, all may be 0
00054         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData()
00055                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(0),
00056                 m_pAliasSwitchList(0),
00057                 m_pThisObject(0),
00058                 m_pScriptFilePath(0),
00059                 m_bAutoDelete(FALSE)
00060                 {};
00061         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData(KviKvsHash * pExtScopeVariables,bool autoDelete=FALSE)
00062                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(pExtScopeVariables),
00063                 m_pAliasSwitchList(0),
00064                 m_pThisObject(0),
00065                 m_pScriptFilePath(0),
00066                 m_bAutoDelete(autoDelete)
00067                 {};
00068         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData(KviKvsSwitchList * pAliasSwitchList,bool autoDelete=FALSE)
00069                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(0),
00070                 m_pAliasSwitchList(pAliasSwitchList),
00071                 m_pThisObject(0),
00072                 m_pScriptFilePath(0),
00073                 m_bAutoDelete(autoDelete)
00074                 {};
00075         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData(KviKvsObject * pThisObject,bool autoDelete=FALSE)
00076                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(0),
00077                 m_pAliasSwitchList(0),
00078                 m_pThisObject(pThisObject),
00079                 m_pScriptFilePath(0),
00080                 m_bAutoDelete(autoDelete)
00081                 {};
00082         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData(QString * pScriptFilePath,bool autoDelete=FALSE)
00083                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(0),
00084                 m_pAliasSwitchList(0),
00085                 m_pThisObject(0),
00086                 m_pScriptFilePath(pScriptFilePath),
00087                 m_bAutoDelete(autoDelete)
00088                 {};
00089         ~KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData();
00090 public:
00091         KviKvsHash * extendedScopeVariables(){ return m_pExtendedScopeVariables; };
00092         KviKvsSwitchList * aliasSwitchList(){ return m_pAliasSwitchList; };
00093         KviKvsObject * thisObject(){ return m_pThisObject; };
00094         QString * scriptFilePath(){ return m_pScriptFilePath; };
00095 };

00097 
00098 class KVIRC_API KviKvsRunTimeContext
00099 {
00100         friend class KviKvsScript;
00101         friend class KviKvsObject;
00102         friend class KviKvsRunTimeCall;
00103         friend class KviKvsEventManager;
00104 protected:
00105         // only KviKvsScript, KviKvsEventManager and KviKvsObject can instantiate this class
00106         KviKvsRunTimeContext(KviKvsScript * pScript,
00107                                 KviWindow * pWnd,
00108                                 KviKvsVariantList * pParams,
00109                                 KviKvsVariant * pRetVal,
00110                                 KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData * pExtData = 0);
00111 public:
00112         ~KviKvsRunTimeContext();
00113 protected:
00114         // stuff that is fixed in the whole script context
00115         KviKvsScript              * m_pScript;                  // shallow, may be 0!
00116         KviKvsHash                * m_pLocalVariables;          // owned, never 0
00117         KviKvsVariantList         * m_pParameterList;           // shallow, never 0
00118         KviKvsVariant             * m_pReturnValue;             // shallow, never 0
00119 
00120         // stuff that is generally global but sometimes may change
00121         // during the execution of the script
00122         KviWindow                 * m_pWindow;                  // shallow, never 0
00123 
00124         enum RunTimeFlags { BreakPending = 1, ContinuePending = 2, HaltCalled = 4, DisableReporting = 8 };
00125         unsigned int                m_uRunTimeFlags;            // a combination of RunTimeFlags
00126 
00127         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData * m_pExtendedData;            // shallow, may be 0
00128 
00129         // error handling
00130         bool                        m_bError;                   // was error() ever called ?
00131         KviKvsTreeNode            * m_pDefaultReportLocation;   // default report location for error()
00132 public:
00133         // the window that this script is bound to (it MAY change during the script parsing)
00134         KviWindow * window()
00135                 { return m_pWindow; };
00136         // quick access to the irc context (it MAY be zero!)
00137         KviIrcContext * context()
00138                 { return m_pWindow->context(); };
00139         // quick access to the console that this script is bound to (it MAY be zero, if there is no console)
00140         KviConsole * console()
00141                 { return m_pWindow->console(); };
00142         // quick access to the connection: it MAY be zero!
00143         KviIrcConnection * connection()
00144                 { return m_pWindow->connection(); };
00145 
00146         // the local variables of this script
00147         KviKvsHash * localVariables()
00148                 { return m_pLocalVariables; };
00149         // the global application-wide variables
00150         KviKvsHash * globalVariables();
00151         // the parameters passed to this script
00152         KviKvsVariantList * parameterList()
00153                 { return m_pParameterList; };
00154 
00155         // parent script, may be 0!
00156         KviKvsScript * script()
00157                 { return m_pScript; };
00158 
00159         KviKvsVariant * returnValue()
00160                 { return m_pReturnValue; };
00161 
00162         // this is the default error reporting location
00163         // it is also used by rfc2812wrapper to find out the current command name!
00164         KviKvsTreeNode * defaultReportLocation()
00165                 { return m_pDefaultReportLocation; };
00166 
00167         // the extended stuff
00168         KviKvsHash * extendedScopeVariables()
00169                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->extendedScopeVariables() : 0; };
00170         KviKvsSwitchList * aliasSwitchList()
00171                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->aliasSwitchList() : 0; };
00172         KviKvsObject * thisObject()
00173                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->thisObject() : 0; };
00174         QString * scriptFilePath()
00175                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->scriptFilePath() : 0; };
00176 
00177         // this MUST be called before any blocking call that might return to the main event loop
00178         // and eventually quit kvirc or close the window that this command is associated to
00179         // Actually this is a NO-OP but later may really do something that avoids kvirc to crash
00180         void enterBlockingSection();
00181         // this MUST be called after exiting the blocking section above
00182         // if this function returns false your parsing code MUST "return false" immediately:
00183         // it means that something rather critical happened and the script
00184         // execution cannot continue
00185         bool leaveBlockingSection();
00186 
00187         // Error handling
00188 
00189         // was error(...) ever called ?
00190         bool error() const { return m_bError; };
00191 
00192         void error(KviKvsTreeNode * pNode,const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00193         void warning(KviKvsTreeNode * pNode,const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00194         void error(const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00195         void warning(const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00196         void setDefaultReportLocation(KviKvsTreeNode * pNode);
00197         bool errorNoIrcContext();
00198         bool warningNoIrcConnection();
00199         bool warningMissingParameter();
00200 
00201 //PRIVATE:
00202         // tricky
00203         // don't use it: it's only for the parser
00204         void setWindow(KviWindow * pWnd)
00205                 { m_pWindow = pWnd; };
00206 
00207         // returns the old pointer
00208         KviKvsVariant * swapReturnValuePointer(KviKvsVariant * pNewPointer);
00209         // the old pointer MUST be reset!
00210 
00211         // this is called by the parser when a break is encountered
00212         // the parser calls setBreakPending() and returns false
00213         // the contexts that can handle a break should check breakPending()
00214         // after an internal evaluation returned false.
00215         // if breakPending() they should handle it with handleBreak() and
00216         // return true instead.
00217         void setBreakPending()
00218                 { m_uRunTimeFlags |= BreakPending; };
00219         // this tells if a break command has been called
00220         // it may return true if an execution() command has returned false
00221         // (if breakPending() there should be no error()
00222         bool breakPending()
00223                 { return (m_uRunTimeFlags & BreakPending); };
00224         // this is called by the commands that can handle a break
00225         void handleBreak()
00226                 { m_uRunTimeFlags &= ~BreakPending; };
00227 
00228         // this is called by the parser when a continue is encountered
00229         void setContinuePending()
00230                 { m_uRunTimeFlags |= ContinuePending; };
00231         // this tells if a continue command has been called
00232         bool continuePending()
00233                 { return (m_uRunTimeFlags & ContinuePending); };
00234         // this is called by the commands that can handle a continue
00235         void handleContinue()
00236                 { m_uRunTimeFlags &= ~ContinuePending; };
00237 
00238         // this is called by the parser when a halt is encountered
00239         // the parser then returns false and all the stack frames
00240         // above should do the same
00241         void setHaltCalled()
00242                 { m_uRunTimeFlags |= HaltCalled; };
00243         bool haltCalled()
00244                 { return (m_uRunTimeFlags & HaltCalled); };
00245 
00246         // this is used by KviKvsScript to disable reporting when the Quiet flag is used
00247         void disableReporting()
00248                 { m_uRunTimeFlags |= DisableReporting; };
00249         bool reportingDisabled()
00250                 { return (m_uRunTimeFlags & DisableReporting); };
00251         void enableReporting()
00252                 { m_uRunTimeFlags &= ~DisableReporting; };
00253 
00254         // clears the error status on this context
00255         // this is useful to continue execution after an error
00256         // and probably used only in /eval
00257         void clearError()
00258                 { m_bError = false; };
00259         protected:
00260 
00261         void report(bool bError,KviKvsTreeNode * pNode,const QString &szMsgFmt,kvi_va_list va);
00262 
00263 };
00264 
00265 #endif //!_KVI_KVS_RUNTIMECONTEXT_H_
